Text.Value: We're fine, Hope. We did it.
But as a wise woman once said, there's no point in crying over spilt blood. We must go on.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to cheer herself up and to find some of her manic energy, but it's missing

Text.Value: She was an entire person before she ever made that choice.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Text.Value: And I hope you have a happy ending of your own.

EditorData.NodeContext: a goodbye. has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: And go where? I don't think I quite know how to be anywhere else but here anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: Don't hold back. Tell me how bad it is.

EditorData.NodeContext: braced for the worst

Text.Value: With a lick of paint and a thorough cleaning, this could be a lovely little house.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a smile. Has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: Let's just get out of here.
But she was an entire person before she ever made that choice.

EditorData.NodeContext: hopeful

Text.Value: Free. I never thought I would be, believed I could be, hoped I might be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Triumphant, words spilling out of her in excited babble

Text.Value: Then we're not just fine, we're spectacular.

EditorData.NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

Text.Value: What a wonderful, jubilant, glorious day.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited

Text.Value: I don't think there was any way to save her.
You truly are the kindest fool I've ever met.

EditorData.NodeContext: pitying the player, despite her affection for them

Text.Value: What will you do?
Nowhere but here. I don't quite think I know where anywhere else is anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: ONWARD

EditorData.NodeContext: EXCITED

Text.Value: That's the hopeful version, of course. The likely version is that WE ARE THE MESSES AND HE IS THE CHOPPER.

EditorData.NodeContext: first sentence is her considering her previous optimiism, and then she delviers the pessimistic version with just as much manic glee

Text.Value: You should come with me.
I hope so too.

EditorData.NodeContext: happy but solemn

Text.Value: Incredible as it seems, we really did defeat Raphael.
I'll hope. What else?

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: I hope I'll see Korrilla again one day, and that she'll say sorry, and I'll tell her she's forgiven.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: It is absolutely preposterous that any of us are alive. Maybe we're not!

EditorData.NodeContext: Shock, wonder, joy

Text.Value: Seriously, there's nothing wrong with you. Physically, at least.
We need to grab your contract, quick as a hiccup, or Raphael will come and chew up your soul.
We both know that's not true, but thank you for being so kind.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a sad smile - player is being kind to her, undeservedly as far as she knows

Text.Value: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love in my heart to guide you home.

EditorData.NodeContext: with genuine love and affection, with an undercurrent of grief

Text.Value: But we must address the hollyphant in the room. I can see how you avoid looking at me. I must be so terribly mutilated after all these decades of torture.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself on first sentence after an outburst. And then delivering lines solemnly, apologetic about her 'appearance', though it's not her fault

Text.Value: *For the first time since you heard her voice, Hope seems calm. And the peace flows from her into you, soothing your very soul.*
HA

EditorData.NodeContext: a short abrupt laugh, reacting to the player pinching themself at her command

Text.Value: You're beautiful, Hope.
*You are wide awake, and Raphael truly is defeated.*
I hope the echoes of pain will fade, and memories of sorrow will die, and that you'll visit me here some day.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: When we were children, she always kept the last piece of pastry for me, and bloodied the nose of the bullies who pulled my hair.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Text.Value: It is not right that she died, and it makes me want to weep an ocean.

EditorData.NodeContext: quietly, composing herself after an outburst on the previous line. Holding back grief as best she can

Text.Value: You were all the luck I needed.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: You look perfectly normal.
Hideous. I can barely stand to look at you.
Farewell. And good luck.
Pinch yourself.
She's my sister. I love her.

EditorData.NodeContext: completely open and honest

Text.Value: No, really. You look fine.
I'd blush if they had left me any skin to redden, and I would kiss you if they had not torn off my lips!

EditorData.NodeContext: excited and ecstatic

Text.Value: I hope I'll find all the pieces of my mind that fell out of my head over all those years, and that I'll be able to put myself back together again.

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: She was my sister.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister, almost breaking into tears

Text.Value: PINCH YOURSELF AND CHECK WE'RE NOT DREAMING THE LAST OF OUR LIVES AS WE DIE SCREAMING

EditorData.NodeContext: intentional rhyme - afraid, but playful with the sing-song tone. she thought she'd just survived a terrible battle, and is now terrified that it was just a dream and she's still a prisoner

Text.Value: You could have broken her in half like a breadstick, but you didn't. I am sorry she fought you, and glad she survived.
She was under Raphael's influence - she didn't deserve to die.
And I can hardly leave - after all, who would ever want to think of Hell without Hope?

EditorData.NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Text.Value: You're too forgiving. After all she did to you, we should have killed her.
That is incredible. We're incredible. We're spectacular.

EditorData.NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

Text.Value: I hope me and Korrilla can be a family again, that bygones can become bygones, and that we can patch up our wounds together.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad and reflective, but optimistic

Text.Value: I shall find a breathable sack to wear on my noggin. But only after we escape.

EditorData.NodeContext: accepting that somebody just told her she was hideous, and offering a solution that should be pleasing to everyone

Text.Value: OH BUT MY POOR SISTER KORRILLA.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sudden shock and grief, an outrburst of emotion

Text.Value: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love left for you as well. I hope it guides you home.

EditorData.NodeContext: with genuine love and affection

Text.Value: MY BEAUTIFUL SISTER IS MOSTLY INTACT
I was just about quite all right with the amount of fight he put up. If anything, I would have preferred less.

EditorData.NodeContext: enthusiastic and excitable

Text.Value: I expected him to put up more of a fight.
Where will you go now that you're free?
She deserves some of the blame - serving him was a choice.

EditorData.NodeContext: slight note of caution

Text.Value: Are you still here, or are you but a dream?

EditorData.NodeContext: lost in her own thoughts, but still happy to see the player

Text.Value: THERE IS ALSO THE SLIM POSSIBILITY THAT WE WIN

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be positive, but has no rational reason to be

Text.Value: We'll carve our way to the entrance hall, and chop Raphael into messes.

EditorData.NodeContext: gleeful

Text.Value: After all she did to you, she doesn't deserve your tears.
I hope the two of you can reconcile.
You don't know the half of what she did.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Text.Value: NO TIME FOR CHITTER-CHATTER

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared but determined

Text.Value: It's tempting to delay the inevitable, but this is it, the big showdown, the final act, the glorious RUIN THAT COMES TO US ALL.

EditorData.NodeContext: increasing volume as she builds to a dramatic crescendo - really looking forward to this despite the very high possibility of failure

Text.Value: She made her choice when she sided with Raphael in the first place.
I hope that was a compliment.

EditorData.NodeContext: suspicious

Text.Value: HEADS WILL ROLL

EditorData.NodeContext: excited, manic

Synopsis:
A dialogue with Hope - in person, not with the spirit form.
First greeting is after players free her - she will start following the player after that as well.
Later, after defeating Raphael, players can talk to Hope, ask who she is, why she was trapped and how's she connected to Raphael.
